metadata.title: CVE-2021-4008 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server in versions before 21.1.2 and before1.20.14. An out-of-bounds access can occur in theSProcRenderCompositeGlyphs function. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xdmx-tools - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xnest - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xorg-server-source - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-common - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xvfb - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xwayland - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
